website_summaries.verdict: Destroys tangles and knots with speed. This brush is ideal for super-thick hair.
pros: The nylon pins of the brush are protected to prevent damage to your hair
The cushion of the brush is soft and actually molds to your head for optimal detangling and brushing
Detangles quickly without putting pressure on your hair
It also removes static from your hair

customer_reviews.title: I’m a believer
customer_reviews.text: As a recent convert to the curly girl method, I wasn’t sure getting a brush was the right move, as many believe in just finger detangling. After watching a bunch of videos of folks using the Denman Brush I decided to give it a go, as I couldn’t get my curls to clump together to look good once my hair dried. The results speak for themselves. I’ve been nothing but elated with my results! The left is the same routine/products before SOTC, the right is the same but with the denman brush. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: good styling tool
customer_reviews.text: excellent results, my 4b hair had poppin curls with a little eco styler gel....and this brush....used a pretty head band and i was good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Amazing you can clean it in a fun way
customer_reviews.text: This is the first brush I found that the cleaning job for the brush itself is so fun. After cleaning each row of teeth, and reassemble them ,You can always have a brush like new.
customer_reviews.author: Xiaolan huang

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's hair is a blessing and a curse, thick, tight curls and coarse and honestly speaking I stop getting thrilled about trying new products BUT this brush was so amazing I had to leave a review. I used a wide tooth comb first and then this brush but it was so easy to use. I wish the handle was thicker with more grip but I'll live. This picture is my daughter's hair after taking out braids so when wet it's 3 times the size in volume.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissi C.

customer_reviews.title: Definition!
customer_reviews.text: I have curly 3c/4a hair and this brush is so amazing at defining my curls!!! I got the 9 row one and it can be a little hard getting it through my hair sometimes but once it does the definition is incredible, even in the front of my hair where it’s a bit wavier. Pics attached - I use EcoStyler gel to style my hair. Two are when my hair is wet and one is while dry.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Grizzle

customer_reviews.title: No grip on handle
customer_reviews.text: I really think this brush had the potential to be an amazing brush but there are a few things very wrong with it. The handle is too skinny for the top heavy brush and it is so slippery when you're using it with wet hands. I find myself holding on to the actual bristles when I use this brush just to get a good handle on it. If this brush had a good rubber grip it would be a million times better. Also, the bristles are kind of sharp so be gentle when using it especially on children's heads.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Detangling made so much easier
customer_reviews.text: This brush worked very well for detangling my 3c curls. I was able to detangle easier than a paddle brush with virtually no “ripping” noises. I noticed a lot less hair in the brush when I was done.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Not a genuine Denman Brush
customer_reviews.text: It has to be a fake. The moment I got it, I noticed the color was off. It was a lot more red than pink. Then I noticed how hard the brush was. They are normally a lot softer. A week later I bought one from Denman and noticed a complete difference. Color and flexibility were different as well as some minor branding details. This was fake.
customer_reviews.author: Virtue08

customer_reviews.title: OMGGGGG....WHERE HAS THIS BEEN ALL MY LIFE!?
customer_reviews.text: ATTENTION ALL NATURALS.... This brush is amazzzzzzzing....I wish I had tried it a long time ago! I have 3C hair and this really helped with detailing my hair. I used it after appling my products to my hair and was really amazed at how good it worked. In the past I as skeptical of buying this because I thought it would snach my hair out, but I only wound up loosing the normal amount of hair that one would loose when detangling there hair. I will never get rid of this brush unless it's needing to be replaced and in that case it will be immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Mikelle

customer_reviews.title: Yes you and the kids and use this
customer_reviews.text: I got another one as well I love the softness of the teeth of the brush I use the all the time on my 2 year old head.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Useless Knock Off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this "Denman" as a back up to the real Denman brush I've been using for the past year. This knock off is nothing like the original. It is flimsy and falling apart after just a few uses. My real Denman is much sturdier and the rubber feels much different.
customer_reviews.author: Lesli Taylo

customer_reviews.title: Buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: This brush really defined my curls!! Love this brush, not the best detangler, but good for defining curls!!! 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Box was crushed and opened inside was dirty! Will be returning
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe this is the real brush, if it is they ship only the poorly made. "Rubber parts are coming apart. Box was crushed and opened inside was dirty! Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MUCH bettter than Goody Brushes
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Goody brand 9 row brushes to blow dry my hair for years. They work great. This time, I didn't see the 9 row Goody brush here on Amazon so I took a chance with this one instead. I only used it a few times so far, but the handle is exactly right for my hand and the quality seems really good for this price. Let's face. It's a plastic brush, with the plastic bristles coming out of a hunk of rubber. Seems to be made better than the Goody. If it lasts, I'll stick with this brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tony NYCTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: There are better brushes out
customer_reviews.text: It works relatively well, I have a combination of type 3 hair and I took out several rows. I noticed if my sections are too big it ends up pulling out my hair and it's just more difficult to work through even after detangled. The handle isn't ergonomic and I can't get a good grip on it because it's smooth and when I have product on my hands it makes it that much more difficult Update: after using a few different brushes I don't reach for this anymore. If I brush a certain way my hair gets caught in the little holes and it pulls ot out, obviously not super pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Don't See The Buzz
customer_reviews.text: For the amount of money this brush cost, I guess I was expecting more. My hair just didn't get it. Yes, it detangled fine. As far as adding curls, never happened, no matter how many YouTube videos I watched, and no matter how many techniques I tried. But, I've got pretty good curls going anyhow, so maybe my expectations were too high. I can get the tangles out with a pick from the Dollar Tree instead of paying all the money I did on this brush, so it just wasn't worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnie C

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical for over a year after reading some bad reviews and people saying it did nothing for them. But I really needed a good detangling brush and nothing else seemed to be as popular. I bit the bullet and bought it. I don't regret it in the least. It's AMAZING in my hair. Goes through like butter. My hair is so curly afterward, rather than frizzy. I will note that my hair is not coarse or 4C, however. It's more 3C/4A, so that might be the difference in how well it works for people.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: The best detangler for my hair....EVER!
customer_reviews.text: My hair does what it wants, usually. When it's moisturized, it's easier to manage, but I am still "tender-headed" to the point that I had stopped getting it done after I went natural (and that was over 12 years ago). With the denman brush, I am able to thoroughly detangle, and reveal my natural curl pattern with the least amount of shedding I've ever experienced. And if you follow the directions and brushed your sectioned hair gently from the bottom up, THERE IS NO PAIN. That was the biggest draw for me, because normally my hair had to be soaking wet and drenched in condtioner.
customer_reviews.author: Feles MalaTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: My favorite brush
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these now and I love them. You can slide out the section the teeth are in, remove all the sets of bristles and clean everything, EASILY. Then put it back together with very little trouble, it's great. Additionally it has a nice weight and I use it exclusively to brush my hair. I wouldn't say it's great for tangles, you'd want to use a wider comb for that first, but for day to day brushing I love it. I got one for myself and liked it so much I bought another for one of my kids.
customer_reviews.author: A. KoubaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money if you have fine hair
customer_reviews.text: This is promoted as a great product to use if you follow the Curly Girl Method, but it's a poorly made product and does not work well on all hair types. The rows of bristles are removable, great, but good luck actually getting the bristle pad to go back into the brush as initially assembled. It doesn't. Also, when pulling a few rows of bristles out, one snapped in pieces. Poorly made. I would not recommend spending any money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous98012

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Love this brush. Compared to other brushes I tried, this one was the easiest and quickest to clean. You slide it out from the handle and pull out the combs and rinse. I was very surprised that it wasn’t difficult to take apart and put back together again. The bristles are different lengths; so I had to be sure I put them in the right spot.
customer_reviews.author: Janie G.

customer_reviews.title: Great For Curly Hair
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this brush would be good for curly hair but it works wonders for my daughters hair. I don't think it's a good brush for detangling as it's very stiff and can break her hair. However, once her hair is detangled then it's great to brush through wet and helps to separate her curls and when dry it gives her better definition. I didn't believe it at first but it really does work.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Foster

customer_reviews.title: Fake or defective brush.
customer_reviews.text: This brushed ripped through my hair. Definitely not the same brush people are ranting and raving over. Listing says it’s sold by denman, but they must send amazon their defective brushes. Would’ve just assumed it was me and the brush didn’t work for me had another person not mentioned it in a group I’m in. Very disappointed. I now learned to keep packaging for returns. Sucks because it’s foonf straight to the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: MoLo

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for a good brush for my wavy hair...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good brush for my wavy hair and I read a lot of reviews claiming this was the answer. It is not. It pulls and rips and feels awful. I tried taking a row of bristles out hoping it would help my waves hold shape or even rip less hair out, but sadly that didn't help. I wouldn't recommend this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing find for curly hair.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this brush! I saw someone on YouTube using it for curly hair and I bought it immediately. So glad I did. I did remove two rows for my bigger curls, but if you use it right out of the shower after dabbing your wet hair, your curls will be much more defined and last all day. My stylist even commented on my curly hair. No products needed in my hair, just the brush. Drying my hair straight, I love this brush because it focuses more air on my thick hair. Dries much faster. My daughter loves how it detangles.
customer_reviews.author: timerqueen

customer_reviews.title: Fake Denman
customer_reviews.text: NOT an authentic Denman brush sold my Amazon Services Inc. You have to go to the Denman website to be sure you get an authentic brush. The bristles on my Amazon purchase are much softer/pliable, the rubber is a different consistency and form (and doesn't fit into the frame properly no matter what I do), and the logo is different than these pictures. I feel taken advantage of.
customer_reviews.author: MelTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: One of my most favorite Curly girl tools!
customer_reviews.text: Love for curly hair. It does a great job of distributing products and defining curls! It would be nicer if they put a rubber grip on it. It's a little hard to hold onto if your hands are wet. I wouldn't recommend using it for detangling unless you're very careful. I usually make sure my hair is rectangle before I use it. It's one of my favorite curly girl tools! It's also very easy to clean, which is important for someone who uses a lot of product in their hair!
customer_reviews.author: Monique Ging

customer_reviews.title: the -perfect- brush
customer_reviews.text: My mom had a brush like this one I was a kid that I absolutely coveted. It was just somehow the -perfect- brush. Finally I tracked it down online and ordered 2 just to be safe. This brush is exactly the same. They knew they had made the prefect brush and they did not change anything. It is such a relief that 60s/70s era quality products can still be produced and bought today if you know where to look. I tell all my friends that the Denman brush is the best one.
customer_reviews.author: Liz C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it best brush ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for, I started the curly girl method and everyone was raving about this brush so I gave in and purchased it, and I’m so glad I did, I use this in the shower and outside the shower. In the shower I use it once I place my conditioner in my hair I begin to brush it out I immediately could feel the difference in my hair because this distributes the conditioner evenly making sure every strand has enough moisture, I love it, go for it, you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: TheLovelyMarrie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't flatten your waves
customer_reviews.text: This brush has widely spaced bristles, so it is like a comb brush. I have fine, thick, wavy shoulder-length hair. I Like how it doesn't flatten my waves the way a typical brush does. I like the way it makes my hair look. Like a comb, you must go slow to keep it from tearing your hair. I think I will be keeping my other brush to massage my scalp and brush my hair out more thoroughly at times, maybe at night. I don't know why a person with straight hair would want a brush like this, unless they want a less brushed look.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Good bristles, but that's about it. Hard to grip. Causes cramping.
customer_reviews.text: The brush itself has very nice bristles, and I love the heaviness of the brush. However, the paddle is so wide, and curves outward, it is almost impractical to use. Least favourite part: the handle is hard and slippery. No grip. This means that it is tough to hold, especially when trying to do my own hair. I get hand cramps after about 5 minutes, and I have wide palms and long fingers (larger than some men, even). So it's not a case of Trump hands - it's the brush. I promise.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: A Good Sturdy Brush for My Thick Curly Hair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Denman 9-row brush to brush out my hair while achieving vintage styles. I have long, thick, naturally curly hair. I like this brush. It brushes through my hair well. The bristles aren't the softest or most comfortable against the scalp, but once you get the hang of brushing using this brush, this is not a big deal. The bristle portion of the brush is heavy and well-made. The sturdiness helps the brush get through my hair nicely. I wish the handle was more substantial and a little bit more ergonomically friendly. I have small hands and I found the brush tough to hold at times.
customer_reviews.author: Lem S.

customer_reviews.title: Wont go through??????
customer_reviews.text: I can't get this through a section, even with my best slip conditioner. Tried it modified and with all the bristles. How the hell does anybody get their curls/coils (3c/4a) through this??? I can't even return it. I was ready for this brush to blow me away, I ended up having to get my Thick and Curly Tangle Teezer to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Siren

customer_reviews.title: Magical
customer_reviews.text: Why am I just discovering the power of this magical brush?! Who’s been keeping this secret?!! Omg. It’s amazing. I’m mixed, with long, thick, very curly hair. I saw this brush recommended on a couple you tube videos, but I’ve only ever used combs Bc brushes just don’t go through my hair. This brush not only goes through my hair, but then somehow smooths my curls into these perfect ringlets?!?! It’s blown my mind .. I think that red backing part must be made of crushed fairies?
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: Have always been able to get nice curls with a wide-tooth comb and a hairbrush. Used my fingers to distribute product and scrunch. Ise this to detangle first and then brush through Kinky Curly custard. Then i finger-scrunch as usual and diffuse upside-down. Game changer. This brush just creates gorgeous shapely curls and no frizz.
customer_reviews.author: Rowada

customer_reviews.title: Much have
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for curly hair. I straightened my hair my entire life so had to retrain them to curl correctly. I use this brush after adding product to wet hair to get perfect spiral clumps and evenly distribute the product into the sections of my hair. It is easy to hold and clean. If desired, it is also easy to remove bristles for curls that are less tight.
customer_reviews.author: Atlantis

customer_reviews.title: Simply a SUPERIOR brush in every way!
customer_reviews.text: The Denman hair-brush simply can't be compared to anything you'll find on the shelves of retail stores. My mom introduced me to the Denman line of brushes when I was a teenager — and after trying many inferior brushes over the years, I've returned to Denman for the quality, the easy untangling and management of my hair, and this brush is incredibly durable. You will not be disappointed; worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce_5800

customer_reviews.title: High-quality, great brush!
customer_reviews.text: Love this brush! I have curly hair. I like to brush my curls out after the shower, then scrunch my curls in my palms lightly to bring back the shape of them after brushing. I used to use the wet brush, and the Denman Brush exceeds this brush in quality by a longshot. I also like using this Denman to dry-brush my hair in between washings, because the tight firm bristles really fluff my hair out, which I enjoy because I think it looks natural, healthy and voluminous! Best brush i've owned yet. This brush also seems very sturdy, high-quality, like it will last me years and years. I would recommend / purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: BEATRICE RAKOWSKI

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it.
customer_reviews.text: Hair Type Guess: 3c4a with maybe a tad of 4b in one place. Years Natural: maybe 4 Years Not Straightening: maybe 1 [lol] Total newb but I hate the Denman. I like Wet better...or just a wide detangling comb. I tried with ALL the rows...and after having removed half of them...still not a fan. And in my polling/viewing/etc other naturals - it is NOT, I repeat NOT, a necessity.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Hill

customer_reviews.title: "Curl" power!
customer_reviews.text: I'm mixed-race, and I have extremely coily hair. I love my corkscrews, but it does annoy me how much length I lose when they're extremely tight (esp. during ultra-humid days.) With this brush, I noticed an immediate slickness to my hair after washing it. The brush also evenly distributed my hair products right after washing (when my hair is still damp) to loosen + soften the curls, while still retaining the spiral of the "curl." I also noticed the brush is causing far less breakage, and is easier to work through my hair during the untangling process. I would definitely recommend to my fellow curly-haired ladies!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M.

customer_reviews.title: Hard material
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very hard material, I bought it for my mom but she was only able to use it twice and then handed it over to my sisters and I so we could give it a try, but it’s being more than a year since I purchased it and it’s just sitting on my sisters’s drawer unused. You can get it if you like hard brushes but it’s not our case.
customer_reviews.author: Julianny Yaromir Castro Severino

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but not for my hair.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is a good product but my hair hates it. I does not glide through my curly, wavy, kinky hair as it apparently does through others', and caused some breakage. On my hair, a wide-tooth comb appears to be best. However, the brush arrived within the expected dates and seems sturdy and well-made. I have no actual complaints--it's just not a product that works for me.
customer_reviews.author: kimberlimmy

customer_reviews.title: Ummmm no
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to love it !!! Omg what happen ? Is this a real Denman Brush ?!? The rubber is cut up very ugly for a finish , I feel like it’s not real and I got ripped off , it FEELS like it could have been sturdy maybe if it was real , I think I’m going to return and order from the Denman website
customer_reviews.author: Kyta

customer_reviews.title: Daughter Loves It
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived early. It was for my 13 year old who has the thickest wavy/curly hair EVER. She had read about it and wanted me to buy it and give it a try. She has to wet her hair daily and add products to it and this brush works great detangling her hair and not causing breakage. Will definitely have to buy a replacement when this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Walker

customer_reviews.title: Cheapy handle is thin and annoying
customer_reviews.text: Love Denmans but compared to my last ones, this handle is cheap and flimsy. And so is the rubber. It's so thin where the teeth pull against it. If you have 4C or thicker it won't last long. I'm so disappointed. Now I know why the 2 pack pops up in the search so much. I had to do a specific search with code numbers to get the single to even result. Maybe I had the heavy styler before, or the company went the way of cheap to save production costs. Idk. But this one kind of sucks by comparison for thick hair. I guess I have to go back to Ricky's. For $21 I didn't expect such flimsy construction.
customer_reviews.author: Glamazon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For My Hick Hair.
customer_reviews.text: I have 4b/c type hair so it tangles very fast. This Denman brush does a great job with detangling it. So far it holds up well, nothing has broken , and it cleans out very easily Update 2/22/16 The brush started to fall apart literally a day later 😑. I'm going to need super glue to put back together. I still use it, and it still does a great job with detangling my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they once were.
customer_reviews.text: The brush I ordered was the 9-row pink cushioned one. I received the 9-row black cushioned one. The one I have been using is about 15-20 years old and is just now starting to wear out and I've always loved them. However, this new one's bristles are much stiffer and the handle is much less robust and smaller so it doesn't feel as good to hang on to. Maybe it's because I received the wrong one or maybe they're all that way now....not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy42

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love what this does to my hair! I've stayed away from brushes my entire life (except for those times where I was trying to be funny and show people why curly haired people do not brush their hair..especially when it's dry). My typical routine was wash, product, plop, then air dry... which I still do when I'm in a hurry. Denman brush has great results but it takes some work since you have to brush strands in parts. whenever I brush my entire hair without sectioning it, my hair dries flat but when I do sections, I get great volume and curls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the 9 Row Brush!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Goody knock-off of this brush for decades, and was always happy with it. Years of blow dryers finally caused the rubber to tear in a couple of places, and thought it best to replace before it completely fell apart. The Goody brush I found has changed, and not for the better so thought I'd try this, and I'm so glad I did! It is sturdy but not harsh, the weight and size are perfect, and my thick, wavy, tame-it-to-be-sleek hair loves it. Gave it to my sister, who has thin hair, she loves it, too. Ideally, it will last forever, but if not, I'll be getting it again.
customer_reviews.author: RSMV

customer_reviews.title: Natural Hair Savior
customer_reviews.text: Love this brush! It keeps my curls curly and doesn't mess up my natural hair. I saw someone else on YouTube talking about this brush and I am so glad that I listened to them. It is great for detangling. It is a little larger than I was expecting, but it does what it needs to do.
customer_reviews.author: nalokaloka

customer_reviews.title: Who knew?
customer_reviews.text: Soo, I read that this brush was for straight hair.. um, no. Curly girls can use it too. I have 3b hair and this really defines my curls! I also LOVE that it can be taken apart to clean!!!! Ohhh, and you can add/take away bristles which I also love.. I can tailor the brush to fit my EXACT needs and hair type. I def recommend if you have curly hair!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DENMAN IS THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: If you have thick hair you need this brush! It doesn't rip your hair apart because it doesn't have those little "balls" on the ends of the nylon bristles. Plus with THIS particular model Denman, you can actually remove rows if the bristles are too dense for your hair. This is the pretty much the only brush on the market that reaches to my scalp and without damaging my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Will easily break long, fine hair.
customer_reviews.text: It catches and easily breaks my long hair, and I don't like that at all. Thorough cleaning involves removing the rubber base which supposedly "slides" in and out easily, but I've cleaned it 3 times, and it is a major tug-of-war like undertaking. And I don't like that. I actually ordered a boar hair brush because I was so disappointed with this one. The major issue, for me, was the catching and breaking of my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for curly hair.
customer_reviews.text: I love this brush, can't say enough nice things. I have thin curly hair and it gets super tangled. Well thid brush does help with that, granted you need to have patience and do it little by little. It helps give my curls definition. I actually prefer to use it before I shower
customer_reviews.author: CrazyKina

customer_reviews.title: Wrap Appeal
customer_reviews.text: The only brush I'll ever reach for again. Heard the hype for years, and ignored it. I was soo mistaken. It detangles my hair with ease, gives me a smoother mane, prolongs my blow-out. For years I've attempted to wrap my hair, and failed. First time using a Denman, and did it like a pro. Woke up to smooth, salon fresh tresses.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. ShopAlot

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't tangle, but plastic bristles hard on scalp
customer_reviews.text: This brush does not tangle my hair, which is great, but the plastic bristles are hard on my scalp because the brush is heavy. Since I bought it and opened the package and used it, I can't return it. So I am careful when I use it so it doesn't press too hard on my scalp.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: All good! It's a well-made brush & helps with de-tangling (my hair is difficult to comb & brush due to knots/tangles). Quality construction & does what it claims to do. PS: I'm trying to get more familiar with the hair classifying system. I am guessing my type is 2c or 3a, but if you can help clarify this for me and comment below, I'd be most appreciative!
customer_reviews.author: Cautious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about buying this brush, I had be contemplating this purchase for a year maybe. After the first use I knew I had to always use it for my curly hair routine. I do not use this to detangle, I use it strictly for styling. I have 3b/3c hair and an prone to frizz. Seems like I don’t get as much frizz when using brush and my curls just look that much better. Hair clumps nicely which makes for great curls.
customer_reviews.author: Leeza S

customer_reviews.title: Best brush for any hair type
customer_reviews.text: This is the only brush that works for me! I have very long hair that is relaxed. My natural hair is curly. It does not snag my hair like the ball tipped ones do, and the bristles are long enough to really get down to the roots and detangle from root to ends. It's gentle on the scalp but firm in detangling. Overall, the best brush I've ever owned and I'll never switch to another. It works on my curly roots as well as my relaxed straight hair.
customer_reviews.author: Latzacar

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these brushes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these brushes! I am a hairstylist and have been for the last 20 years and the Denman brush is fantastic for straightening and smoothing frizzy or curly hair. I have bought from the seller many times and my packages always arrive on time reasonably price with zero issues. I would definitely recommend this brush and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Molly M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't get it
customer_reviews.text: I have very tangles curly hair and I can't get this thing through my hair. I have seen the reviews and I don't get how others brush their hair. I use a wet brush that had flexible bristles and it makes a big difference. This brush does not have flexible bristles and literally makes me want to cry getting it through my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda RasmusonTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Love This Brush!
customer_reviews.text: This brush is really helpful in detangling my hair. I have very thick, type 4 hair, and this brush really helps to get through each section and detangle without breaking the ends. It works better for me when I wet my hair.
customer_reviews.author: SynnaBuy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This brush has some popularity and I understand why. I’m transitioning into going naturally curly and this brush does something so unique. It separates and somehow allows your hair to curl beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Croft

customer_reviews.title: Best Natural hair brush
customer_reviews.text: Best brush for curly natural hair. I have 3A/3B curls and found this has always been the best brush for definition and detangling. I broke my last brush after a few months of use and tried other brushes but I never found the same results like this brush. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Francine rivera

customer_reviews.title: Love/Hate Review
customer_reviews.text: Bought because of its growing popularity in the curly hair community. I dont like it for detangling. It pulls a little too much for my liking. I love it for defining curls though. It's a little difficult to put back together after taking it apart to clean. It's not my go to/everyday styling brush but when I want defined curls, I know what to pick up!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for taming curly/frizzy hair when wet
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these years (and years) ago as the wide-spaced thicker, firm bristles were perfect for working with my curly/frizzy hair when wet. After I eked the very last bit of life out of that one because I couldn't find a similar style anywhere in local (Chicago) stores, the lightbulb finally went on and I searched for and found it on line. Doh. Don't know why this basic workhorse isn't on every hair-care shelf in stores, but I guess your mileage may vary. For me, it's indispensable.
customer_reviews.author: Lethe

customer_reviews.title: Denman's the only way to go for my natural head!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order as my old brush has worn out. I ordered back in 2016 and with my thick coily hair has lasted nicely. It can still be used for my grandkids hair as it isn't as thick as my own. I will remain with this brand as long as they keep making this quality level of brushes. Also, the best deal is on Amazon as in-store prices were higher.
customer_reviews.author: RetArmyGrl2019

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Hype
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used off brand “denman-like” brushes for years, but they would all eventually break. Finally caved and bought the real thing. I have extremely curly hair and on wash day this brush is a staple to help detangle + help my conditioner work into my hair. It’s auper sturdy, so I’m hoping it lasts awhile. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Archer

customer_reviews.title: A classic brush that is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape of the handle. It is easy to hold. The brush head works well for brushing and styling. The brush is durable and easy to clean. This is the third Denman brush I own. I will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: VOY

customer_reviews.title: Denman keep your brush
customer_reviews.text: I got mixed reviews from you tube and my friends and family about this brush. So I decided to try it for myself. Thumbs down it literally pulled my 4C hair out. Needless to say I returned to brush asap!!.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Not for fine long hair
customer_reviews.text: I have fine long hair and this is NOT the brush to use for blow drying or... anything. Its super stiff plastic bristles are merciless. I thought I got the information from the reviews that this would be good for fine hair, but no.
customer_reviews.author: Wu

customer_reviews.title: Love this brush!
customer_reviews.text: Love this brush! Detangles hair without any pain. Use this on my kids and have less complaints. Also works well with helping their curls pop more.
customer_reviews.author: Melania

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy brush!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice brush so far. Have just used it to brush wet hair. Brush comes apart while brushing hair. Kind of annoying. Looking forward to trying to use it to make curls. Have curly hair and the reviews says it's good for makes nice girls! We'll see!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Best brush I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Now this brush has some weight to it. And when slippery with conditioner it may feel like it'll slip out of your hands. It clups my curls while reducing frizz I instantly get more definition with little product. It disrupts my natural curl pattern (2c-4b) to smooth and gather it. I can't wait to see what else it can do. I have yet to move the bristles and I can tell they won't be breaking on me.
customer_reviews.author: LaPrietaLinda

customer_reviews.title: A durable "naturalista" must-have
customer_reviews.text: This is a natural hair must have. My previous Denman brush lasted about 3 years and would have likely lasted longer had it not endured a beating from dealing with lots of rough, synthetic-hair wigs. I have a mixture of 4a-4c textured hair and this detangles it easily. It can even be used for shingling if my hair is very damp or saturated with product.
customer_reviews.author: Mz. SB

customer_reviews.title: I really love this brush
customer_reviews.text: I really love this brush. I am transitioning right now and I would say that it definitely makes it easier to control my frizz. I use this brush to straighten my hair using the chase method and it makes such a difference. It looks like my hair was straightened at a salon. I've yet to use the brush on wet curly hair but will report soon if it helps bring my curls out or not.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: I simply love my Denman brush
customer_reviews.text: I simply love my Denman brush. I used one for years, then got sidetracked by all the round, paddle, boars hair, etc goodies that came along. Then I got my hair cut in a new style and couldn't get it to cooperate until I remembered how well the Denman worked for me...success! I have very thick and coarse hair, but it tames it. I have used it on my granddaughters' whose hair is long and fine with no problems as well. I look forward to many years with this brush. My old one was around for a very long time and this definitely is as well made.
customer_reviews.author: anne m.

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as I thought it'd be
customer_reviews.text: I took out some of the rows of bristles so the brush could detangle my hair better, but it just acts like a regular brush to me. And the red rubber piece won't slide all the way back into it's original place ever since I took it out to remove the bristles. I've seen reviews of this brush where people have had no trouble getting the red part where it should be, not sure what's wrong with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: be careful. What your ordering is a cheap knock ...
customer_reviews.text: be careful. What your ordering is a cheap knock off. its not the denman brush. instead you get some "KH" knock of from China.
customer_reviews.author: Ahdumb

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I used to somewhat dread wash days because I hated detangling. This thing makes it such a breeeeeeze. I love feeling the bristles on my scalp. I have very thick and curly hair, and the only time I would actually brush my hair was when it's straight. All other times I'd comb it with a widetooth comb. That doesn't do very much for buildup though. This brush helps to break up scalp buildup and stimulate my scalp! I absolutely love it. I want to buy one for my mom too!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Daily

customer_reviews.title: Perfect performance with a cheap design
customer_reviews.text: I'm honestly saddened not to put a 5 stars review on this brush. Its been a little more than a month of having it and the gold letters in the back of the brush are already fading out. Everything else is as expected. I saw a lot of videos of this brush's performance and that's why I got one, however, I'm detailed oriented and this tiny aspect kinda disappoints me a lot, for a brush that claims to be so fab. for $21 in a brush I wouldn't expect these flops.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had listened....
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had listened to others about it ripping out your hair, and if your hair and hands are slick with product and the brush slips out of your hand, the bristles will stab your hands! This brush is definitely not for detangling, atleast not for 4-type hair.
customer_reviews.author: Karynn

customer_reviews.title: Love the curl definition on my curly wavy texture
customer_reviews.text: I've never used anything besides a Denman since I purchased this 2 years ago. The only thing I don't like, & I suppose it happens to all brushes? Eventually the bristles aren't going to be sturdy and move with your hair if there's any tugging. For me that caused more tugging. You won't find a brush to define your curls like this one. Now I believe I'm a 3b the way curly type, but I've tried this on my sister 4c and it detaches great but I didn't see any definition in her curls. Just a heads up from,what I observed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for fine frizzy hair
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for myself and it hurt using it. I guess my hair is too fine and frizzy. Gave it to my husband who has thick wavy hair and it was perfect for him. I gave it 3 stars since the brush itself seems good quality. Husband would give it 5 stars since he's happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: LillyM

customer_reviews.title: Love this brush!
customer_reviews.text: This brush gives my daughter’s hair life! It’s literally life changing for her curls! So glad we purchased. It gets a little slippery to handle when using product but it’s all good.
customer_reviews.author: TIFFANY

customer_reviews.title: Best brush i've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Had this brush for 3 years now, this brush goes through my hair better then any brush I had in the past, and with no rounded tips added to the teeth, you get none of that nasty fuzz that always get stuck in it, which you can't get out. It doesn't scratch your scalp. I love this brush!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Jones

customer_reviews.title: I dunno, might be a knock off
customer_reviews.text: This doesnt slide out as expected, the rubber part doesnt protrude from the top so there is nothing to push on to slide it out, i do like how it feels on my scalp, better after removing half the bristles. I had to put the whole runner part up and out likea banana peel if that makes sense
customer_reviews.author: kristine

customer_reviews.title: Great for detangling and styling type 4 hair
customer_reviews.text: I am 100% satisfied with my Denman brush. In fact, I used it to brush my guy's hair and he loved the feel of it so much that I ordered another one just for him. I have short type 4 hair - the brush made detangling a breeze and gave my wash and go's lots of definition. He has waist length wavy indian hair and the brush detangled his hair with water only. Plus, every stroke feels like a mini scalp massage. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Rea

customer_reviews.title: Great detangling brush for 3C hair
customer_reviews.text: Denman Cushion Nylon Brush arrived today and I immediately tested it out. I am mixed with 3C hair and am always on the search for a detanglig brush that will withstand lots of abuse lol this brush feels substantial, not cheap, and is bigger than I thought it would be. I will update if I lose any bristles but I think this brush may be a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Rudi H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for detangling and defining curls
customer_reviews.text: My go to brush for detangling and defining my hair. Handle gets a little slippery of course when using different products but that’s to be expected. Definitely does it’s job when it comes to natural hair
customer_reviews.author: Porsche Simone

customer_reviews.title: Evenly distributes hair products or hair's oils
customer_reviews.text: I brush my hair well before the shower to distribute my natural oils to the ends of my long hair. The staggered bristle pattern does this really well. It also smooths hair nicely. And a breeze to keep truly clean since it comes apart. No more yucky fuzzies etc.
customer_reviews.author: Raechel S

customer_reviews.title: If you have wavy hair like me, this can help you straighten your damp ...
customer_reviews.text: The only reason why this isnt a 5 star review is because the bristles really hurt. However this works well, I am a guy with 2 inch long hair. I rock the typical Comb over look and this brush serves two purposes. 1) It combs your hair really well. If you have wavy hair like me, this can help you straighten your damp hair after the showers long enough for you to style it. 2) it helps give you get the lift and volume when styling the front part of your hair if you rock the Comb over as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jayr

customer_reviews.title: Like
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my transitioning hair - I like it AFTER I realized I needed to remove a few rows of the nylon bristles! LOL the less rows makes it act like more of a detangler than brush. If I would have known that, I would have ordered the less expensive 5-row brush. You would think the rubber would snag on wet hair, but it actually helps slide the brush through (with product on hair) Only downside is after i removed the bristles and tried to slide the rubber back into the handle, it won't push all the way in.
customer_reviews.author: Monique N. Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good brush for curls, not good for detangling
customer_reviews.text: This brush is pretty nice! I like the fact that the curls are nice once you brush it right! Hit it with some flax seed gel and you're ready for a day out! The reason I took a star off is because it isn't a good brush for detangling. I tried to detangle but it just doesn't work. But once detangled the brush makes great curls.
customer_reviews.author: C. Urban

customer_reviews.title: Average brush
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay. Nothing special about it. Bought it for my daughter’s hair hoping it would better help with her tangles, it does but works just as any other less expensive brush.
customer_reviews.author: Velia Balderrama

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Hype!
customer_reviews.text: I heard about this brush through Youtube and thought I'd give it a try. It is everything you've heard/read about and more. So so so reasonably priced too. This brush does a great job of grouping my curls together and making them look bouncier and fuller. When I style my hair with the Denman, my wash and go lasts for 3-4 days, whereas before I couldn't leave it unwashed for more than 2 days. This brush has saved me so much time from not having to do my hair every morning, and money from using less products regularly. I'd 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets rid of tangles fast!
customer_reviews.text: This brush is magical! I bought it based on recommendations from YouTube hair gurus, mainly to tame a horrid weave I bought here on Amazon. The brush detangled the entire matted weave in less than 5 minutes, vs the 15 minutes I used to waste with my other brush. I LOVE how sturdy the bristles are too. Glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: Topazamazon

customer_reviews.title: It’s a nice brush.
customer_reviews.text: My wife’s favorite brush. She says it gives her hair good volume. Personally I’ve never heard her hair make a sound. But what the heck do I know?
customer_reviews.author: EmceeGraffiti

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 4C natural hair.
customer_reviews.text: I use this brush on my wigs and my natural hair and I am not disappointed at all. This brush is super easy to clean when removing shed hairs and is great at detangling wet freshly washed and deep conditioned hair. not truly sure where this brush has been all my life but I cannot live without it on wash days to be honest. I haven't used it for blow drying as I don't use a ton of heat but I really do think this brush would be able to get the job done just right.
customer_reviews.author: Kia Sangria

customer_reviews.title: If you have hair, you need this brush.
customer_reviews.text: We love this brush in our house. We have several. Works well with most hair types from straight to curly, fine to thick, and wet or dry. It is very durable. I still own the first Denman brush I bought over a dozen years ago.
customer_reviews.author: N. Theodosiou

product_meta.title: Denman Classic Styling Brush 9 Row - D4 - Hair Brush for Separating, Shaping & Defining Curls - Blow-Drying, Styling & Detangling Brush – Black
product_meta.description: Size:9 Row| Color:Black9 row, smooth nylon pins in an anti-static, natural rubber pad. Perfect for smoothing, shaping and polishing the hair.
feature_bullets: Nine rows of sculpted round-ended nylon pins separate, shape hair and define curls when hair is wet
The styling edges of the half-round brush create tension when shaping the hair during blow-styling
Unique pin pattern provides extra grip and tension
Wash in warm, soapy water. Rinse and leave to dry away from direct heat and sunlight.
Remove loose hair from brush with a comb
Perfect for smoothing, shaping and polishing the hair
Large styling brush with 9 rows of nylon pins
Anti-static rubber pad that provides maximum grip and control during blow-drying for shaping hair

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
